channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: On a testé la Navee XT5 Pro, une trottinette électrique au look agressif et des pneus de 12 pouces rassurants
item.description: Derrière son look sportif, la trottinette électrique Navee XT5 Pro cache de belles prestations de conduite, un bon confort et une connectivité intéressante, mais déçoit clairement par sa puissance continue, son autonomie ainsi que son freinage périlleux sous la pluie. Nous l'avons testée. Voici notre verdict.

item.title: This ‘Wet Lava Ball’ in Space Somehow Clings to an Atmosphere
item.description: The hot super-Earth exoplanet has a magma ocean and orbits a very old star.

item.title: The Best Motorola Phones (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Motorola phones may seem old-school, but their reasonable prices, colorful designs, and simple software make them good, wallet-friendly Android smartphones.

item.title: Six questions to ask when crafting an AI enablement plan
item.description: AI's greatest threat is the growing number of untrusted/unmanaged apps that access company data without company knowledge.

item.title: The Best Kindle of 2025: Paperwhite, Scribe, or Colorsoft?
item.description: Here’s how Amazon’s ebook readers stack up—and which one might be right for you.

item.title: IKEA launches three new Qi2.0 wireless phone chargers – including one with a hidden double function
item.description: IKEA has launched three VÄSTMÄRKE chargers, and they'll work with Apple MagSafe and Google Pixelsnap.

item.title: Cette puissante enceinte Bluetooth notée 8/10 est quasi à moitié prix sur pour les fêtes de fin d’année
item.description: Robuste, étanche, endurante, l'Ultimate Ears Wonderboom 4 ne semble présenter que des qualités. Pour renforcer votre envie de l'acheter, Amazon divise son prix presque par deux puisqu'elle passe de 99,99 euros à 56,99 euros.

item.title: How Governments Turn the Internet Into a Weapon
item.description: From protests to elections, governments are increasingly pulling the internet plug on entire populations. Connectivity is slowly becoming a tool of control, not a guarantee.

item.title: Google Data Centers Are Returning Nuclear Power to Tornado Country
item.description: A destructive storm in 2020 prematurely shut down Iowa’s only nuclear plant. With Google’s plans to reopen it to power nearby data centers, will extreme weather threaten the reactor’s safety?

item.title: The 24 Best Shows on Amazon Prime, WIRED’s Picks (December 2025)
item.description: Bat-Fam, The Girlfriend, and The Mighty Nein are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Amazon Prime Video this week.

item.title: 5 essential low-impact muscle-building moves for over 50s, according to an expert Peloton trainer
item.description: I spoke to a Peloton professional trainer to get the best tips for staying fit and healthy when over 50.

item.title: How to watch England vs Jamaica for *FREE* — Stream Netball Horizon Series on BBC iPlayer
item.description: Here's our streaming guide on how to watch England vs Jamaica in the Netball Horizon Series from anywhere in the world.

item.title: I tried this Amazon best-selling soundbar from Bose, is it really worth buying?
item.description: I tested Bose’s Amazon best-selling soundbar – is it worthy of my recommendation?

item.title: ‘Comfort is the enemy of acting’: Is Lucas Bravo pleased to get a break from Emily in Paris season 5 in this new HBO Max show?
item.description: Before Emily in Paris season 5 even started filming, rumors were rife about Gabriel's return. With all that in mind, I'm convinced star Lucas Bravo is enjoying another role much more.

item.title: Walmart's huge gaming laptop deals include up to $400 off RTX 5000 models with prices cheaper than Black Friday
item.description: Looking for a gaming laptop this Christmas? You won't beat these three gaming laptop deals in the Walmart seasonal sale.

item.title: How Taylor Swift is turning the NFL’s mass-media machine into a a pipeline for new male fans
item.description: The pop star’s latest album rollout has been carefully planned to cross over into the world of football—right when sports fans have been primed to be more receptive. In the tournament of pop culture—an arena increasingly obsessed with charts, data, and stat lines—Taylor Swift has, by most measures, already emerged the victor.
